results.title: A Land fit for heroes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
Examines the harsh reality that lay behind the concept of parcelling out plots of land for soldiers returning from both the first and second world wars. Uses archival footage, interviews and old radio broadcasts. Reporter - Ron Iddon. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Kiwis
results.creator_credit: Paul Williams, John Sparkes, Janet Bell and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
Ernie Leonard, a Maori who had relinquished his traditions and heritage became chief of his tribe at the age of 55. He had been a television compere, later becoming a television producer and Ernie was able to show how he had learnt language and traditions and helped in fostering this knowledge in the young. He now produces a television program in Maori each week called ‘Koha’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Williams, John Sparkes, Janet Bell and Australian Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: Dingo country
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
A fence almost 6,000 miles long stretches from South Australia to Queensland and attempts to separate the dingo from the sheep. The dingoes are vigorously hunted and killed, but the film presents the view that man must learn to acept the dingo.
results.description:

results.title: Running to stand still
results.brief_description: Adrian Bush tells the story of how, after spending most of his life on the move, he found friendship and a sense of belonging playing street soccer in Fitzroy, Melbourne, with others from the Big Issue team. Adrian was selected for the Australian street soccer team, which toured internationally, and appeared in an ABC documentary. His experiences with the Big Issue and street soccer have transformed Adrian’s life.

results.title: My best mate
results.creator_credit: Aaron Austin and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Huss was polite, generous and non-judgemental. Big Issue vendor, Aaron Austin paints a portrait of a man from the war-torn country of Somalia who, despite his violent upbringing, was kind to everyone who crossed his path. A soccer fan and storyteller, Huss was taken from Aaron when he was stabbed in the doorway of his flat in 2007.

A soccer fan and storyteller, Huss was taken from Aaron when he was stabbed in the doorway of his flat in 2007.

results.title: Mind's eye
results.creator_credit: Brandon Tomlin and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: For years, I have been compiling images in my mind’s eye, while passing through the laneways of Richmond, to the neon lights of Melbourne. Despite having cerebral palsy, Brandon Tomlin lives independently and spends his time taking photos of Melbourne and surrounding suburbs. This is a compilation of some of his work.

results.title: Memories of a radio
results.creator_credit: Gordon Preston and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Gordon Preston talks about his life, his love of the radio and the comfort it brings him. He shares key experiences from his life, like when he first arrived in Melbourne by ship and his vivid dreams and how his radio has followed him everywhere, sometimes illuminating the life he is missing out on, sometimes illuminating his memories and dreams.
results.description: Gordon Preston talks about his life, his love of the radio and the comfort it brings him. He shares key experiences from his life, like when he first arrived in Melbourne by ship and his vivid dreams and how his radio has followed him everywhere, sometimes illuminating the life he is missing out on, sometimes illuminating his memories and dreams.

results.title: How I see it on the street
results.creator_credit: Robbie Williams and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: The way I see it, there are a lot of bums in the world. Stories from a Big Issue vendor who operates from a wheelchair, about the variety of bums in the world and how they behave towards him.

results.title: Put back together
results.creator_credit: Clarissa Hall and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: I love angels. They are very peaceful. When I look at an angel sitting at home with all its scars, it reminds me of all the people who have guided me. Clarissa Hall gives an open account of her life, from leaving school early, to the degrading sheltered workshops and, eventually, to becoming a Big Issue vendor. She talks about her battle with mental illness and recovery and her hopes for her future.
results.description: I love angels. They are very peaceful. When I look at an angel sitting at home with all its scars, it reminds me of all the people who have guided me. Clarissa Hall gives an open account of her life, from leaving school early, to the degrading sheltered workshops and, eventually, to becoming a Big Issue vendor. She talks about her battle with mental illness and recovery and her hopes for her future.

She talks about her battle with mental illness and recovery and her hopes for her future.
